chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant James N Luke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.075(1r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit for 224 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Register as a sex offender.
  Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Disclose to any physician in writing your supervision.  Sign any Release Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James N Luke in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Bricco makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:
Imposed Sentence of:
7 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 224 days)
5 Years of Initial Confinement
2 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
Inform agent of all prescriptions;
Disclose to any physician in writing your supervision
Sign any Release for Agent;
Register as a sex offender
Cost: $268.00 
DNA surcharge: $250.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Steven Braam Ph.D.;   Filed with cover letter dated February 5, 2016 from Atty Katie Bricco
Sentencing hearing at 02-08-2016 10:00 am
